discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
it is A

Selected Answer: A
UiPath Document Manager is a lightweight web application that allows users to prepare, review and make corrections to datasets required for Training and Evaluation of Document Understanding Machine Learning models. It enables multiple users to perform a variety of operations:

Define and configure the fields to be extracted by an ML model.
Import documents for labeling.
Prelabel documents using a preexisting ML model such as Invoice Extraction or Receipt Extraction provided by UiPath out-of-the-box, or by using a model trained using AI Center.
Label documents.
Export documents in the format expected by the AI Center Training pipelines.
The correct answer is option A!

questions.question_text: What is the name of the web application that allows users to prepare, review, and make corrections to datasets required for Machine Learning models?
Which of the following training modes can be used to improve a UiPath Communications Mining’s model’s Balance?
Which of the following is true when creating an ML Package in UiPath AI Center?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
Important: Before uploading packages, make sure they are built as specified here.
When creating an ML Package in AI Center™, it cannot be named using any python reserved keyword, such as class, break, from, finally, global, None, etc. Make sure to choose another name. The listed examples are not complete since package name is used for class <pkg-name> and import <pck-name>.

choices.B: The package name cannot exceed 10 characters in length
choices.A: The package name cannot use any Python reserved keywords
choices.C: The package name cannot contain any spaces or hyphens
choices.D: The package name cannot include any special characters such as “@”, “S”, or “#”

questions.question_text:
DRAG DROP
-

What is the correct order of migrating a dataset from Document Manager to a Modern Project?

Instructions: Drag the Description found on the left and drop on the correct Step found on the right.

//IMG//

What does the following expression do?
subTotalAdditions.Select(Function(field) CDec(documentFields(field))).ToList.Sum() + subtotal

choices.B: Sums up all the line amounts and converts the fields to CDec.
choices.D: Sums up the subtotal to the total variable by converting it to CDec.
choices.C: Sums up all the line amounts converted to CDec and the subtotal.
choices.A: Sums up subtotal fields from the config file converted to CDec with the subtotal.
